intro: Eriogonum heermannii var. clokeyi, commonly known as the Clokey’s buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to California. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces numerous tiny, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal scrub habitats. This variety is known for its adaptability to dry conditions and is an important component of local ecosystems.
